title: Thermostat Not Sending Signal
description: The AC system appears completely dead. Indoor and outdoor units are not responding even though the thermostat display is on and set to cool.
symptoms: No response from indoor or outdoor unit
Thermostat display works and shows call for cooling
No clicking sounds from anywhere in system

faults.description: Thermostat is not closing the Y (cooling) circuit - internal relay failure

diagnosticSteps.action: Measure voltage between R and C terminals at thermostat
diagnosticSteps.hint: If no 24V, check transformer or wiring

diagnosticSteps.action: Measure voltage between Y and C with thermostat calling
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: Should read ~24V when calling for cooling

diagnosticSteps.action: Remove thermostat, jumper R to Y at the sub-base
diagnosticSteps.hint: If unit starts with jumper, thermostat is the problem

diagnosticSteps.action: Check voltage at contactor coil terminals
diagnosticSteps.hint: No voltage confirms control signal problem

learningObjectives: Understand the 24V control circuit in HVAC systems
Use jumper testing to isolate thermostat problems
Trace control wiring from thermostat to contactor
